t: Why,*pn Lord,*s do you stand far off? Why*ld do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
In*pn his arrogance the wicked man hunts down the weak, who*ld are caught in the schemes he devises.
He*ln boasts about the cravings of his heart; he*ld blesses the greedy and reviles the Lord.*s
In*ln his pride the wicked man does not seek him; in*ld all his thoughts there is no room for God.
His*ln ways are always prosperous; your*ld laws are rejected by him; he*ld sneers at all his enemies.
He*ln says to himself, “Nothing will ever shake me.” He*ld swears, “No one will ever do me harm.”
His*pn mouth is full of lies and threats; trouble*ld and evil are under his tongue.
He*ln lies in wait near the villages; from*ld ambush he murders the innocent. His*ln eyes watch in secret for his victims;
like*ld a lion in cover he lies in wait. He*ln lies in wait to catch the helpless; he*ld catches the helpless and drags them off in his net.
His*ln victims are crushed, they collapse; they*ld fall under his strength.
He*ln says to himself, “God will never notice; he*ld covers his face and never sees.”
Arise,*pn Lord!*s Lift up your hand, O God. Do*ld not forget the helpless.
Why*ln does the wicked man revile God? Why*ld does he say to himself, “He*ld won’t call me to account”?
But*ln you, God, see the trouble of the afflicted; you*ld consider their grief and take it in hand. The*ln victims commit themselves to you; you*ld are the helper of the fatherless.
Break*ln the arm of the wicked man; call*ld the evildoer to account for his wickedness that*ld would not otherwise be found out.
The*pn Lord*s is King for ever and ever; the*ld nations will perish from his land.
You,*ln Lord,*s hear the desire of the afflicted; you*ld encourage them, and you listen to their cry,
defending*ln the fatherless and the oppressed, so*ld that mere earthly mortals will*ld never again strike terror.
